1117921077785710592.text: If a miner wants his variation in yearly payout to be less than your pool fee of F, then you need your pool to win a fraction of blocks=1/(144*365*F^2). For F=1% this is a pool size of 19%. I suggest this is the organic reason for the long-observed hashrate distribution. 1/8pic.twitter.com/jDQCMoRSL3

1096088760784175104.text:
Users can secure their funds using multi-sig ONLY for those coins that support multi-sig in the protocol itself OR have a well tested multi-sig implementation.

Our SSSS implementation works at the BIP39 mnemonic level, as a result users can secure their funds for ALL coins.

1094655476090863621.text:
Jameson Lopp inspired us to create a product using Shamir secret sharing scheme that makes it super simple for everyone to secure their private keys/funds and covers all the attack vectors. 

Thanks @lopp .pic.twitter.com/RipHo5PVTW

1094211438074347521.text:
Multi-sig works at the tx level and Shamir secret sharing scheme (SSSS) at the private key level. 
We support both these features but feel SSSS is much more convenient for our users to secure their funds as they don't need signatures from multiple devices for doing every tx.

1093233400322887681.text:
Some attack vectors and UX challenges @CoinsafeApp has solved in its secret sharing implementation are :

Attack Vectors :
- TD Collusion
- Making sure only user knows their TDs

UX challenges :
- See health of TDs, add/delete TDs
- Getting rid of passwords

TD = Trusted Devices

1093099997023870976.text:
Shamir secret sharing scheme has been around for a long time as a method to secure one's private keys but there hasn't been an implementation with a good UX that mitigates all the attack vectors.

That's why we created @CoinsafeApp .

* Not a medium-of-exchange token
* Clear valuation model (expected discounted future tx fees minus node operation cost)
* Requires running node to get returns, not passive income (so more legally defensible)

974113659596177408.text:
Flow of a transaction in @zilliqa 
1)Transaction of a sender address always goes to a particular shard(double spend check)
2)Shards create microblocks (of txs) using PBFT & send to DSC
3)DSC creates a block again (of microblocks) using PBFT

#Zilliqa @zilliqatrader @xinshudongpic.twitter.com/3GXn0ddfFa

945553279999553536.text:
Some of the important things to consider when investing in an ICO or cryptocurrency are:

1) Purpose of token/coin in the platform and in general

2) Team, advisors and their past work experiences

3) How developed is the product/prototype

4) Amount being raised

5) Tokenomics
